duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage all phases of the funeral arrangement, from setting up funeral services to final disposition
Present every client family with all service and merchandise options
Contribute to the overall efficiency of the location by maintaining open and effective communication and maintaining accurate and timely client files
Improve market share through participating in community events, groups, organizations, and other community relationships
Oversee all Team Members participating in services, ensuring that each member of the team understands their role and is professionally representing the location
Communicate areas of successful performance and performance needing improvement to meet business expectations
Work on-call/first call, in rotation as assigned, i.e., phone, face to face, at the hospital, hospice, residence
Transfer decedents, dresses, and caskets, and prepares deceased on an as-needed basis (per appropriate licensing) to the instruction obtained from the family
Meet with client families to listen, educate and arrange personalized funeral services and ensure their business experience with the business is of the highest quality
Utilize systems/technology to review merchandise options, enter contracts, and complete necessary forms at the time of arrangement conversation
Complete tasks and details resulting from the arrangement conference
Ensure proper paperwork, including permits and certificates, is completed timely and follows relevant laws and regulations
Conduct and attend funeral services regularly, leading all post-service follow-ups as needed
Collect funds at the time of arrangement conferences

education_certification.credential: Valid state-issued funeral director license (as per state licensing requirement)
